meta.content: ODH’s mission is to protect and improve the health of all Ohioans by preventing disease, promoting good health, and assuring access to quality health care.

a.onclick: if (typeof wptheme != 'undefined') wptheme.contextMenu.init({ 'node': this, menuId: 'skinAction', jsonQuery: {'navID':ibmCfg.portalConfig.currentPageOID,'windowID':wptheme.getWindowIDFromSkin(this)}, params: {'alignment':'right'}});
a.onmousemove: javascript:if (typeof i$ != 'undefined' && typeof wptheme != 'undefined') { i$.removeClass(this,'wpthemeActionDisabled'); this.onmousemove = null; }
a.onkeydown: javascript:if (typeof i$ != 'undefined' && typeof wptheme != 'undefined') {if (event.keyCode ==13 || event.keyCode ==32 || event.keyCode==38 || event.keyCode ==40) {wptheme.contextMenu.init(this, 'skinAction', {'navID':ibmCfg.portalConfig.currentPageOID,'windowID':wptheme.getWindowIDFromSkin(this)}); return false;}}

strong.span: If you have questions regarding Coronavirus/COVID-19 please call 1-833-4-ASK-ODH (1-833-427-5634)

div.p: It’s National Infant Immunization Week (NIIW)! NIIW is a yearly observance highlighting the importance of protecting children two years and younger from vaccine-preventable diseases (VPDs).

a.span: about the article: National Infant Immunization Week 2020

div.p: The website www.coronavirus.ohio.gov and the Ohio Department of Health call center are ready to answer your questions about COVID-19.

a.span: about the article: Questions about COVID-19?

div.h2: Head-Neck Cancer stats and facts for Ohio
div.p: Head-Neck Cancer stats and facts for Ohio

a.span: about the article: Head-Neck Cancer stats and facts for Ohio

div.p: National Cancer Registrars Week is April 6-10.

a.span: about the article: Celebrating National Cancer Registrars Week

div.div: Welcome to the Ohio Department of Health’s website, which offers a range of public health information, tools and resources. Our mission is to "Advance the health and well-being of all Ohioans."

img.div: Amy Acton, MD, MPH, Director of Health

img.alt: Image of Ohio Department of Health Announces Statewide Breastfeeding Hotline

p.title: Ohio Department of Health Announces Statewide Breastfeeding Hotline

a.p: Ohio Department of Health Announces Statewide Breastfeeding Hotline

div.div:
April 08, 2020 -
COLUMBUS – The Ohio Department of Health (ODH) has announced a 24/7 Statewide Breastfeeding Hotline available to mothers, fathers, and caregivers across Ohio.

img.alt: Image of ODH Receives All Allocated PPE from the Strategic National Stockpile

p.title: ODH Receives All Allocated PPE from the Strategic National Stockpile

a.p: ODH Receives All Allocated PPE from the Strategic National Stockpile

div.div:
April 02, 2020 -
COLUMBUS — A critical part of our state’s effort to contain and stop the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is to ensure our healthcare providers, Emergency Medical Services, law enforcement...

img.alt: Image of Ohio Department of Health Opens Call Center to Help With COVID- 19 Response

p.title: Ohio Department of Health Opens Call Center to Help With COVID- 19 Response

a.p: Ohio Department of Health Opens Call Center to Help With COVID- 19 Response

div.div:
March 06, 2020 -
(COLUMBUS, Ohio)— Ohio Department of Health Director Amy Acton, MD, MPH, today announced the Ohio Department of Health (ODH) has opened a call center to answer questions regarding coronavirus (COVID-19).

img.alt: Image of Ohio Department of Health to Update Coronavirus 2019 Numbers Daily

p.title: Ohio Department of Health to Update Coronavirus 2019 Numbers Daily

a.p: Ohio Department of Health to Update Coronavirus 2019 Numbers Daily

div.div:
March 02, 2020 -
(COLUMBUS, Ohio) — The Ohio Department of Health (ODH) will start a new process for publicly sharing updates on Persons Under Investigation (PUIs) for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

hr.p: In Ohio, there are currently 113 local health departments. This includes general health districts (county), city health districts and combined health districts (county and city).
Click here for a comprehensive search tool, to locate your local health department by address.

div.div: Are you looking to do business with the Ohio Department of Health? We have various contract and subgrant opportunities. Check our Funding Opportunities section for more information.

div.p: The Ohio Collaborative to Prevent Infant Mortality (OCTPIM) and the Ohio Equity Institute (OEI) are each working with interventions which may reduce the risk of infant or fetal death. Please visit their respective pages to learn more.
Text During COVID-19 shutdowns, Harm Reduction Ohio will provide free Naloxone by mail.
TechCred helps Ohioans learn new skills and helps employers build a stronger workforce with the skills needed in a tech-infused economy.
The Ohio Department of Health is proud to be accredited by the Public Health Accreditation Board.
Children of parents who talk to their teens about drugs are up to 50% less likely to use drugs.
An initiative to help use pain medication safely and responsibly to minimize the risk of drug misuse, dependency and addiction.
